label: Grocery
description: Supermarkets, hypermarkets, specialty food retailers, and convenience stores selling food, beverages, household products, pharmacy items, and prepared meals, characterized by extreme perishability complexity and razor-thin margins.
characteristics: Extreme perishability (30-50% of sales, 1-7 day shelf life)
Massive SKU complexity (30,000-60,000 SKUs, 100,000+ in hypermarkets)
High transaction volumes (300-500K transactions/week for large chains)
Food safety critical (HACCP, FDA regulations, recall management)
segments: Traditional Supermarkets (Kroger, Albertsons, Publix) - Full-service, 40K-50K SKUs, pharmacy, prepared foods
Hypermarkets (Walmart Supercenter, Target SuperTarget) - 100K+ SKUs, grocery + general merchandise
Warehouse Clubs (Costco, Sam's Club, BJ's) - Membership model, bulk sizes, limited assortment (4K-6K SKUs)
Natural/Organic (Whole Foods, Sprouts, Fresh Thyme) - Premium positioning, organic focus, smaller format
Discount Grocery (Aldi, Lidl, Save-A-Lot) - Limited assortment (1K-2K SKUs), private label, ultra-low cost
Convenience Stores (7-Eleven, Wawa, Sheetz) - Small format, grab-and-go, fuel/foodservice combo
